need a -j ACCEPT to the iptables line: you shouldnt need to do that -- iptables is a kernel module and reads from some config file -- iptables-save should suffice
iptables is not a init.d script eh -- its a kernel module -- named iptable_filter
there is an exectuable that loads, lists, and saves the kernel modules
the netfilter_iptable kernel module loads the rules, /sbin/iptables -L lists them and /sbin/iptables-save saves them
yes, as I said.  they are in /sbin
but not in /etc/init.d tho -- which explains why peirce141 couldnt find any iptables files there

you probably have an alias for ls that turns on colours
try -- alias ls='/bin/ls'
